intro: Abutilon crinitum, commonly known as the silky abutilon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, lantern-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in warm, sunny environments and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Its fibrous bark and hairy foliage make it a distinctive and ornamental species in botanical gardens.
distribution_native_art_desc: Abutilon crinitum is primarily native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is commonly found in regions such as California, Arizona, Nevada, and Utah. This plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils or along streambanks.
